general_advisory: As per Extended Range Forecast of IMD, rainfall is normal and both maximum and minimum temperature is expected to be normal for Odisha state during 14th to 20th July, 2024 so, farmers are advised to take necessary action towards kharif crop cultivation. Farmers should start main field preparation for transplanting of paddy seedlings and vegetable crops and also start planting new fruit crops in orchard by taking the advantage of prevailing rainfall conditions. Prevailing weather condition is favorable for sucking insect pest such as mealy bug, aphids etc. attack in all type of crops so farmers should spray Thiamethoxam 25% WG @ 0.5-0.6g or Imidacloprid 17.8% SL @ 0.5ml or Lambda Cyhalothrin 4.9 % CS per liter of water to control this insects. Cloudy weather along with high relative humidity may favour various disease infestation in standing crop so its regular monitoring should be advised. Farmers are advised to store the rainwater by making broad and elevated bunds for future use during any dry spells.

advisory: By taking the advantage of previous rainfall farmers should start field preparation for nursery sowing of Paddy.
Before sowing, seed treatment should be done with Carbendazim 50% WP @ 2g/kg of seeds or Trichoderma @ 10 g/kg of seeds.
Farmers those are already done sowing, advised to thin weaker plants in the cotton field at 10-12 days after germination and gap filling is done with planting of seedlings raised in polythene bags.

Prevailing weather condition is favourable for sucking insect pest attack in nursery of vegetable crops so it's regular monitoring should be advised and after noticing the attack, spraying of Thiamethoxam 25% WG @ 0.5-0.6g or Imidacloprid 17.8% SL @ 0.5ml per liter of water should be advised under clear weather.
Farmers should start raised bed nursery preparation for kharif vegetable crops with proper drainage system to avoid waterlogging.
Deworming and vaccination of animal against FMD, HS and BQ should be ensured at the beginning of commencement of monsoon (rainy season).
Soft and tender grass is more palatable to cattle, but magnesium deficiency is seen in dairy cows when eating too much litter, so a variety of grasses should be fed instead of just soft grass.

During the rainy season, make provision to ensure proper ventilation by allowing an opening of 1-2 ft at the top of side curtains during the day and the side walls of the empty shed should be completely covered with polythene curtains.
Deworming and vaccination of poultry birds against ranikhet disease must be ensured.
